amendment.purpose: An amendment to expand the reporting requirements in the bill for congressional committees with regard to proposed legislation containing mandates. The provisions of the amendment would require committee reports to contain a statement of the degree to which the federal mandate would affect both the public and private sectors, and include a description of any actions taken by the committee to avoid adverse impact on the competitive balance between the two sectors. (Text of the amendment was printed as amendment No. 105 in the Congressional Record of January 19. 1995.).

vote.text: On agreeing to the Portman amendment (A044) Agreed to by voice vote.
